children.name: Healthy Diets
Species diversity
children.label: NA

children.name: Diversity of species in supply per country, calculated from FAO food balance sheets using Shannon's diversity index
children.label: Count
children.source: For countries, data obtained from Roseline Remans (pers. comm.). Original data source was FAO food balance sheets. For projects, data obtained from project team.

children.name: FAO calculates the share of dietary energy supply derived from cereals, roots and tubers (kcal/cap/day) (3-year average). For the ABD Index, we calculate the share of dietary energy supply derived from sources other than cereals, roots and tubers (kcal/cap/day) (3-year average) as 100-FAO share
Functional diversity
children.label: NA

children.name: Number, age-standardized rates, and proportion of deaths and DALYs attributable todietary risks among adults at the global level in 1990 and 2017.
children.label: Count
children.source: Supplement to: GBD 2017 Diet Collaborators. Health effects of dietary risks in 195 countries, 1990–2017: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2017. Lancet 2019; published online April 3. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0140-6736(19)30041-8.

children.name: Sustainable Agriculture
Landscape complexity
children.label: NA

children.name: This indicator is calculated using European Space Agency land use land cover maps rescaled to approximately 1 km x 1 km. Each pixel that contains at least 10% cropland is classified as an agricultural landscape. Each of the agricultural landscape pixels that contain at least 100 ha of natural land (i.e. all land types except urban or cropland areas) are classified as having at least 10% natural land. Mosaic cropland pixels were counted as 50% agricultural and 50% natural. The indicator reports the percentage of agricultural landscape pixels with at least 10% natural land.
children.definition: Percentage of agricultural landscapes with at least 10% natural land
children.source: ESA CCI land use land cover map (2015)

children.name: Soil biodiversity
children.label: NA

children.name: Mean potential soil biodiversity index
children.label: Soil biodiversity index
children.source: JRC Global soil biodiversity map. Accessed at: https://esdac.jrc.ec.europa.eu/content/global-soil-biodiversity-maps-0#tabs-0-description=0&tabs-0-description-2=. Citation: Orgiazzi et al. (2016)

children.name: Species biodiversity
children.label: NA

children.name: This indicator uses the SPAM (2010) 42 crop physical areas (a) dataset to calculate the number of crops in each cropped pixel. From FAO national crop production data we found the average harvested crop richness per country is 44. We use a threshold of 22 (i.e. half of the global average) as an indicator of diversified areas and then calculate the percentage of all cropped areas that are diversified in a country.
children.definition: Percentage of agricultural land (pixels) with >= 22 crops
children.source: SPAM (2010), FAO national crop production data

children.name: This indicator uses the SPAM (2010) 42 crop production areas to calculate the shannon index per pixel. We use the mean average value per country.
children.definition: Average shannon index per country on harvested area across 42 crops
children.label: Dimensionless (larger values are better)

children.name: This indicator uses FAOSTAT crop production data to count the number of harvested crops per country in 2017 (the latest year)
children.label: Count

children.name: Current & Future Options
Underutilized/ local crops
children.label: NA

children.name: Diversity of neglected and under-utilized species per country, calculated from occurrences in inter-tropical regions.
children.definition: NUS species diversity in intertropical regions
children.label: Count
children.source: Bioversity (Elizabeth Arnaud, Marc Deletre and Hannes Gainsberger in 2014 - unpublished)

children.name: This indicator represents the extent of species’ representation within protected areas. The indicator is composed by two subindicators. The first one (GRSin) is a geographic measurement that estimates the proportion of the species ranges within protected areas (i.e. species range within protected areas as a proportion of its total range). The second measure (ERSin) is an ecological measurement of the ecological variation of the species range overall and within protected areas. The final in-situ indicator values are calculated as (GRSin+ERSin)/2.
children.source: Khoury, Colin K, Daniel Amariles, Jonatan Stivens, Maria Victoria, Steven Sotelo, Chrystian C Sosa, Julian Ramírez-villegas, et al. 2019. “Comprehensiveness of Conservation of Useful Wild Plants : An Operational Indicator for Biodiversity and Sustainable Development Targets.” Ecological Indicators 98 (June 2018). Elsevier: 420–29. doi:10.1016/j.ecolind.2018.11.016.

children.name: This indicator estimates the degree of representation of species in living plant conservation repositories. Three scores are used: the Sampling Representativeness Score (SRS), the Geographical Representativeness Score (GRSex), and the Ecological Representativeness Score (ERSex). (Khoury et al. 2019)
children.source: Khoury, Colin K, Daniel Amariles, Jonatan Stivens, Maria Victoria, Steven Sotelo, Chrystian C Sosa, Julian Ramírez-villegas, et al. 2019. “Comprehensiveness of Conservation of Useful Wild Plants : An Operational Indicator for Biodiversity and Sustainable Development Targets.” Ecological Indicators 98 (June 2018). Elsevier: 420–29. doi:10.1016/j.ecolind.2018.11.016.

children.name: Species diversity
children.label: NA

children.name: Gamma species diversity of crop wild relatives occurences, calculated with Gini-Simpson Index. We take the mean value per country.
children.label: Count
children.source: Sotelo H (2017). A global database for the distributions of crop wild relatives. Version 1.8. Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT). Occurrence Dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/jyrthk accessed via GBIF.org on 2018-04-21.

children.name: Gamma diversity of species in gene banks, calculated from accession records. We take the mean value per country.
children.definition: Species diversity in gene bank accessions
children.label: Count
children.source: Genesys accession records (2018). Accessed at: https://www.genesys-pgr.org/explore

children.name: Varietal diversity
children.label: NA

children.name: Gamma diversity of varieties in gene banks, calculated from accession records. We take the mean value per country.
children.definition: Varietal diversity in gene bank accessions
children.label: Count
children.source: Genesys accession records (2018). Accessed at: https://www.genesys-pgr.org/explore
